com.soa.security.script

Class Subject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.soa.security.script.Subject

  • public class Subject
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Subject in a scripted environment.

    You can gain access to an authenticated subject of a message by specifying the category of the subject you wish to gain access to. Retrieving the subject for the end-user is performed as follows: 

        subject = message.getSecuritySubjects().get(
       "urn:org:federatedgovernance:security:subject-category:enduser");

    From there you can get information about the subject as follows:

    You can retrieve all the public credentials: 

        creds = subject.getPublicCredentials();

    Or you can retrieve a public credential of a known type such as a certificate chain: 

        certs = subject.getCertificateChain();
    // traverse the chain
    for (i = 0; i < certs.length; i++) {
       cert = certs[i];
    }

    You can create a new subject that can be added to a message for use downstream as follows: 

        subject = Subject.create();
    message.getSecuritySubjects().put(
       "urn:org:federatedgovernance:security:subject-category:enduser",
       subject);

    You can add public credentials such as a new name: 

        name = Name.create("MyName");
    subject.addPublicCredential(name);

    You can also remove a public credential as follows: 

        subject.removePublicCredential(name);

    You can add private credentials such as a password: 

        pswd = Password.create("password");
    subject.addPrivateCredential(pswd);

      • create

        Creates a new Subject.
        Returns:

      • getPrincipals

        public Principal[] getPrincipals()
        Returns the list of principals associated with the Subject. Changes to the list will not be reflected in the subject.
        Returns:
        List of Principals.

      • getPublicCredentials

        public java.lang.Object[] getPublicCredentials()
        Returns the list of public credentials associated with the Subject. Changes to the list will not be reflected in the subject.
        Returns:
        List of credential Objects.

      • getCertificateChain

        public java.security.cert.X509Certificate[] getCertificateChain()
        Returns the chain of X.509 certificates associated with the Subject. Changes to the list will not be reflected in the subject.
        Returns:
        X509Certificate[]

      • getBST

        public BST getBST(java.lang.String type)
        Returns the Binary Security Token (BST) public credential with the given type associated with the subject (if any).
        Parameters:
        type - String URI representing the type of BST public credential to return.
        Returns:
        BST of the given type, null if not present.

      • getInputName

        public Name getInputName()
        Returns the Name public credential public credential associated with the subject (if any). Note this credential is an unauthenticated name. To obtain the authenticated name of the subject use getPrincipals().
        Returns:
        Unauthenticated Name public credential, null if not present.
